triples.name: Diffusion model
triples.relevance: The paper uses diffusion models as the foundational generative modeling technique for representing robot policies.

triples.name: Robot learning
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel approach to robot learning through diffusion-based visuomotor policy learning.

triples.name: Langevin dynamics
triples.relevance: The paper uses stochastic Langevin dynamics steps during inference to optimize policies with respect to the score function gradient.

triples.name: Transformer (deep learning)
triples.relevance: The paper proposes time-series diffusion transformer as a key technical contribution for visuomotor policy learning.

triples.name: Model predictive control
triples.relevance: The paper incorporates receding horizon control, which is the principle behind model predictive control, as a key technical contribution.

triples.name: Reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: The paper addresses policy learning, a fundamental concept in reinforcement learning, using a diffusion-based approach.

triples.name: Manipulator (device)
triples.relevance: The paper benchmarks Diffusion Policy on robot manipulation tasks across multiple robot learning benchmarks.

triples.name: Score function
triples.relevance: The paper learns the gradient of the action-distribution score function and uses it during inference via Langevin dynamics optimization.
